clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Response to the Conventional Periodontal Treatment Based on the Blood Group Phenotypes.
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Role of ABO Blood Group in the Response to the Nonsurgical Periodontal Treatment.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to find out if one blood group phenotype is more responsive than the others to the nonsurgical periodontal treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first (research) randomized clinical trial that assesses how patient respond to the nonsurgical periodontal treatment based on their blood group phenotype.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- systematically healthy.
- have at least 20 teeth excluding the third molars.
- had not received any periodontal treatment or antibiotic therapy for dental or medical reason 6 month prior to the study.
- diagnosed with generalized chronic periodontitis (>30% of the sites have probing depth â‰¥4), and a minimum of six teeth with probing depth of 5-6 mm.
Exclusion Criteria:
- smokers and alcoholics.
- pregnancy.
- history of a systematic disease such as diabetes, leukemia, epilepsy.
- participants who are unable to perform routine oral hygiene.
- use of orthodontic appliances.
- participants who are unable to perform routine oral hygiene.
